image.altText: Two WA Police forensic officers in protective clothing take photographs of a bag and other items on train tracks.

items.synopsis: A Perth man who fatally attacked an intellectually disabled charity shop worker because he wanted to go to prison is sentenced to life in prison, with a 19-year minimum.

title.children: 'Random and violent': Perth man jailed for murder of disabled man at train station

image.altText: A feral cat lying on the ground snarling at the camera.

items.synopsis: A deadly new tool is being rolled out that will kill feral cats by spraying them with a toxic gel, as part of a five-year plan to reduce the enormous impact the predators are having on native wildlife.

title.children: Deadly tool that sprays feral cats with toxic gel unveiled as part of Australia-first strategy to save wildlife

image.altText: A woman with medium length hair holds a box of vapes in a warehouse. She is wearing a navy blazer.

items.synopsis: A truck carrying 17,000 vapes worth $1 million is intercepted in Perth, but there has been just one prosecution despite promises to clamp down on the illegal trade.

title.children: Tip-off leads to record-breaking vape seizure, but just one prosecution despite crackdown pledge

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

items.synopsis: The latest monthly consumer price indicator shows inflation fell sharply to 5.6 per cent over the 12 months to May, down from 6.8 per cent in April.

title.children: Inflation falls sharply, 'soft enough to see the RBA halt' rate rises

image.altText: Three-year-old William Tyrrell has been missing from his NSW mid north coast home since late last week.

items.synopsis: The foster mother is maintaining she has nothing to do with William's disappearance as detectives ask the public prosecutor to consider charges relating to hiding the toddler's body.

title.children: William Tyrrell's foster mother demands to see all evidence against her after police recommend charges

image.altText: Road workers stand on an empty highway cordoned off with traffic cones.

items.synopsis: A teenage girl is under police guard in hospital after allegedly being behind the wheel of a crash in northern Victoria that has left a female passenger dead.

title.children: Fourteen-year-old girl the driver in fatal collision, police say

image.altText: A black and white graphic of the two men against a Russian map with a red semi-circle behind them.

items.synopsis: Recent developments in Russia raise serious questions about the future of President Vladimir Putin and the war in Ukraine. Look back on our Q&A as our experts unpacked your questions.

title.children: Q&A: Is Putin in trouble? Our experts answered your questions about the war

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie.

items.synopsis: The ex-husband of a former owner of a Canberra lobbying firm has used parliamentary privilege to make explosive claims that it planned to offer kickbacks to former Liberal minister Stuart Robert in return for support to win contracts.

title.children: Lobbying firm allegedly planned to funnel money to Stuart Robert in return for favours, former employee claims

image.altText: Donald Trump (left) in a white shirt and black jacket. A blonde smiling woman (right) wearing sunglasses and brown jacket.

items.synopsis: The former US president is alleging she falsely accused him of rape after a jury found that he sexually abused her, and is seeking retraction and compensation.

title.children: Trump countersues E Jean Carroll for defamation

items.synopsis: A young woman who spat at and punched staff at the Hindley Street McDonald's in Adelaide's CBD in October has been sentenced to an 18-month good-behaviour bond.

title.children: 'Maccas spitter' first person to be sentenced under harsher retail assault laws in SA

image.altText: Army tanks driving in a paddock under a blue sky.

items.synopsis: Australian soldiers were training alongside Japanese and US forces when two military vehicles rolled over in north Queensland.

title.children: Soldiers and marines taken to hospital after vehicle rollover during defence training exercise

image.altText: Noelene and Cedric Jordan pictured walking in a city street.

items.synopsis: If you saw them in the street you might think they seem like most older married couples — but a jury has just found them guilty of the shooting murder of their former son-in-law in 2009. So, why did it take 11 years to charge them?

title.children: The 'elimination matrix' which brought this grandfather and grandmother undone

image.altText: Lady in pin jumper looking at camera

items.synopsis: More than half the country experiences disrupted sleep, but an Australian-first clinical trial of a bacteria-based treatment for insomnia is delivered "very promising" results.

title.children: Could treating the gut help people like Jodie finally get a good night's sleep?

image.altText: Brisbane inner city suburbs rooftops solar panels

items.synopsis: Australia's energy transition has reached a tipping point, and experts are warning consumers to brace for a bumpy ride over the next decade.

title.children: Some households expected to do 'more of the heavy lifting' in green energy pivot, experts say

image.altText: Bill Shorten at a press conference

items.synopsis: Stressing that no current NDIS participants will be removed from the scheme, NDIS Minister Bill Shorten says reforms to the scheme may lead to fewer future entrants with psychosocial disability, as the government seeks to curb growth by 27,000 over the next few years.

title.children: Fewer people with psychosocial disability may be added to NDIS, as minister flags 27,000 to be diverted under reforms

image.altText: People walking in Brisbane's Queen Street Mall

items.synopsis: The latest monthly consumer price indicator shows inflation eased sharply to 5.6 per cent over the 12 months to May, down from 6.8 per cent in April. Follow our live blog for the latest updates.

title.children: Future interest rate rises uncertain as inflation hits 13-month low of 5.6pc

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The ASX 200 index has put on 1.2 per cent today after headline inflation fell to 5.6 per cent in May from a year go. That's the markets largest one day rise since April as investors hope the RBA will leave official interest rates on hold next week. Nearly all sectors made gains with a strong showing from consumer firms, industrials, technology, banks and energy stocks. Casino group Star Entertainment (+11.5 per cent) was the best performer, while Bega Cheese (-8.5 per cent) was the worst perfromer.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Australian share market rallies on inflation pull back

children.content: The ASX 200 index has put on 1.2 per cent today after headline inflation fell to 5.6 per cent in May from a year go.
That's the markets largest one day rise since April as investors
hope the RBA will leave official interest rates on hold next week.
Nearly all sectors made gains with a strong showing from consumer firms, industrials, technology, banks and energy stocks.
Casino group Star Entertainment (+11.5 per cent) was the best performer, while Bega Cheese (-8.5 per cent) was the worst perfromer.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: National Australia Bank says high services inflation in the monthly consumer price data for May suggests firms are continuing to pass on a large share of higher costs to customers. It expects the Reserve Bank to keep raising official borrowing costs to 4.6 per cent in coming months. So it's warning "don't be head-faked by the fall in the monthly CPI indicator." It says while there was a sharp fall in fuel and travel prices in May from a year ago, core inflation only fell marginally. "Today's data suggests firms are continuing to pass through a large share of input cost increases, which if sustained would challenge the RBA's forecasts of getting inflation back to 3 per cent by mid 2025." Prices for rents, electricity and insurance surged over the year.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: NAB says don't be "head-faked" by consumer inflation fall

children.content: National Australia Bank says high services inflation in the monthly consumer price data for May suggests firms are continuing to pass on a large share of higher costs to customers.
It expects the Reserve Bank to keep raising official borrowing costs to 4.6 per cent in coming months.
So it's warning "don't be head-faked by the fall in the monthly CPI indicator."
It says while there was a sharp fall in fuel and travel prices in May from a year ago, core inflation only fell marginally.

"Today's data suggests firms are continuing to pass through a large share of input cost increases, which if sustained would challenge the RBA's forecasts of getting inflation back to 3 per cent by mid 2025."
Prices for rents, electricity and insurance surged over the year.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Retailer Harvey Norman (+5.2 per cent) has jumped today. That's despite saying it expects before tax profit for 2023 to come in at around $670 million, down from nearly $943 million last year. It expects net property valuations of $119 million over the year. Online bookmaker Pointsbet (+1.2 per cent) has unanimously recommended an improved offer from Fanatic's Betting and Gaming to buy its US business for $333 million. Rival suitor DraftKings has abandoned its offer for the business. Private hospital operator Ramsay Health Care (+5.4 per cent) and its Malaysian partner Sime Darby are considering the sale of their healthcare joint venture in Malaysia, Ramsay Sine Health Care (RSD). "The decision has been reached following the receipt of significant inbound interest in RSD at values that are in shareholder interests," Ramsay told the ASX. Reuters reports that big miner Rio Tinto (+0.9 per cent) is setting up a battery testing plant at its research hub in suburban Melbourne. Chief executive of minerals Sinead Kaufman told a mining conference that the company was constructing a battery laboratory. "At this lab, we will build our own batteries, allowing us to test how our minerals and other products will perform in real world applications, such as electric vehicle batteries," she says.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Harvey Norman predicts profit fall

children.content: Retailer
Harvey Norman
(+5.2 per cent) has jumped today.
That's despite saying it expects before tax profit for 2023 to come in at around $670 million, down from nearly $943 million last year.
It expects net property valuations of $119 million over the year.
Online bookmaker Pointsbet
(+1.2 per cent) has unanimously recommended an improved offer from Fanatic's Betting and Gaming to buy its US business for $333 million.
Rival suitor DraftKings has abandoned its offer for the business.
Private hospital operator
Ramsay Health Care
(+5.4 per cent) and its Malaysian partner Sime Darby are considering the sale of their healthcare joint venture in Malaysia, Ramsay Sine Health Care (RSD).
"The decision has been reached following the receipt of significant inbound interest in RSD at values that are in shareholder interests," Ramsay told the ASX.
Reuters reports that big miner
Rio Tinto
(+0.9 per cent)
is setting up a battery testing plant at its research hub in suburban Melbourne.
Chief executive of minerals Sinead Kaufman told a mining conference that the company was constructing a battery laboratory.
"At this lab, we will build our own batteries, allowing us to test how our minerals and other products will perform in real world applications, such as electric vehicle batteries," she says.

image.altText: Elly looking distressed

items.synopsis: A Melbourne court hears one of convicted paedophile Malka Leifer's victims lost her baby during the trial into the former principal's child sexual abuse, as she and her sister detail how the impact of their abuse left them "utterly broken".

title.children: Victim of paedophile principal Malka Leifer reveals loss of baby days before verdict

image.altText: A man wearing dark glasses walking outdoors with his head bowed.

items.synopsis: The NSW District Court hears ex-Newtown Jets rugby league player is guilty of carnal knowledge, related to sexual activity with one of his high school students in the 1980s.

title.children: Former Sydney teacher Chris Dawson found guilty of sexual activity with student

image.altText: An orca jumps out of the ocean with mountains in the background

items.synopsis: A pod of orcas swims into the bay at Merimbula, including one that has been sighted on and off for 15 years.

title.children: 'Holy grail' of whale watching captured right next to the NSW coastline

image.altText: Scott Morrison, wearing a long winter jacket, walks out of a construction site followed by two men and a woman.

items.synopsis: Multiple previously secret reports scrutinising the $2.3 billion HomeBuilder scheme have found a lack of governance, controls and risk management.

title.children: HomeBuilder scheme 'overheated' construction and blindsided states, reports find

image.altText: Premier Daniel Andrews wearing a blue suit and glasses.

items.synopsis: Two years after former St Kilda footballer Rod Owen shared his story, Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews announces an inquiry into child abuse at Beaumaris Primary School.

title.children: 'Children should feel their safest at school': Andrews announces inquiry into abuse at Victorian school

image.altText: Scaffolding and a tunnel with train tracks in it.

items.synopsis: The ABC has been given exclusive access to one of five new underground stations being built as part of the Metro Tunnel Project. Despite some cost overruns and controversy, test trains are expected to start running later this year.

title.children: Take a sneak peek at one of Melbourne's new underground train stations

image.altText: An alleged Australian-built cardboard drone lies nose down with a twig stuck in it

items.synopsis: Photos appear online purporting to show an Australian-made drone that recently crashed inside Russian territory with an explosive strapped to it.

title.children: Pro-Putin military bloggers claim Australian-built cardboard drone was brought down inside Russia

image.altText: A man in a suit with his arms folded

items.synopsis: New details of the case emerge in court, with the Sydney businessman accused of selling Australian defence and security secrets in China.

title.children: Sydney man accused of foreign interference was warned to leave China by suspected US spy, court hears

image.altText: Former Queensland Health acting director-general Shaun Drummond

items.synopsis: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk says Shaun Drummond's decision to quit as Queensland Health director-general is his own, and that when he was appointed last October he said he would not stay for the full term.

title.children: Queensland Health boss resigns days after disagreement with minister

image.altText: Taylor Swift's Facebook profile picture

items.synopsis: General sale tickets will be released on Friday, but Swift fans will be attempting to secure their spots in a special pre-sale event. It's going to be tense.

title.children: Taylor Swift pre-sale tickets are released today. Sellers are braced for huge demand

image.altText: Jordans and Shane Barker composite thumb.

items.synopsis: A jury takes just nine hours to unanimously find a Tasmanian couple guilty of murdering their former son-in-law Shane Barker in 2009.

title.children: Tasmanian couple sentenced to 22 years in jail for murder of ex son-in-law

image.altText: Gambling advertisement at an AFL game.

items.synopsis: Committee chair Peta Murphy says Australians are among the biggest gambling losers anywhere in the world, and previous attempts to regulate gambling advertising have failed to address the problem.

title.children: Gambling ads should be banned within three years to tackle addiction crisis, parliamentary committee says

image.altText: a tub of coyo yogburt sitting on a bench in the sun

items.synopsis: A Sunshine Coast company which manufactures "dairy-free" coconut yoghurt and ice cream products is being sued in the Queensland Supreme Court following a woman's death in the UK.

title.children: Queensland 'dairy-free' yoghurt manufacturer COYO sued after UK woman's anaphylaxis death

image.altText: Servicemen sit in a tank with a flag of the Wagner Group military company.

items.synopsis: When Ivan Rossomakhin returned home from the war in Ukraine three months ago, his neighbours in the village east of Moscow were terrified.

title.children: A convicted murderer fought for Wagner in Ukraine. Ten days after returning to Russia, he allegedly killed an elderly woman

image.altText: A toddler strapped into a pram.

items.synopsis: The death of 17-month-old Ronan this month is declared a major crime. No arrests have been made or charges laid. Here's a look at what is known so far. WARNING: This story contains details readers may find distressing.

title.children: This 17-month-old was allegedly murdered — here's what we know so far about Ronan's death

image.altText: A man in a business shirt and tie looks seriously off the camera.

items.synopsis: The Northern Territory Court of Appeal has dismissed former NT Police constable Zachary Rolfe's bid to avoid questions at the coronial inquest into the death of Kumanjayi Walker.

title.children: Court rules Zachary Rolfe must give evidence at Kumanjayi Walker inquest

image.altText: A man smiles while wearing Baltimore Ravens football gear.

items.synopsis: Former Patriots, Ravens and Texans quarterback Ryan Mallett dies in an apparent drowning at a Florida beach.

title.children: Former NFL starting quarterback dies in apparent drowning at Florida beach

image.altText: The back of a white ute, with the word "Jovi" graffitied on the back in black spraypaint.

items.synopsis: The Jon Bon Jovi Boys, or Jovi Boys, hail from a remote community of less than 200 people. Residents there say they're "terrorising" the community and they've had enough of their bad behaviour.

title.children: 'They've got no respect': Jon Bon Jovi Boys outback gang in sights of NT police
